#define SMCR_ETR_MASK ((uint16_t)0x00FF)
#define CCMR_OFFSET ((uint16_t)0x0018)
#define CCER_CCE_SET ((uint16_t)0x0001)
#define CCER_CCNE_SET ((uint16_t)0x0004)
#define CCMR_OC13M_MASK ((uint16_t)0xFF8F)
#define CCMR_OC24M_MASK ((uint16_t)0x8FFF)

section.title: void TIM_DeInit (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Deinitializes the TIMx peripheral registers to their default reset values.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_TimeBaseInit (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_TimeBaseInitTypeDef *TIM_TimeBaseInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Time Base Unit peripheral according to the specified parameters in the TIM_TimeBaseInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_TimeBaseInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_TimeBaseStructInit (TIM_TimeBaseInitTypeDef *TIM_TimeBaseInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each TIM_TimeBaseInitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: : pointer to a TIM_TimeBaseInitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void TIM_PrescalerConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t Prescaler, uint16_t TIM_PSCReloadMode)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Prescaler.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Prescaler Register value

specifies the TIM Prescaler Reload mode This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_PSCReloadMode_Update: The Prescaler is loaded at the update event.
TIM_PSCReloadMode_Immediate: The Prescaler is loaded immediatly.

section.title: void TIM_CounterModeConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_CounterMode)
section.emphasis: Specifies the TIMx Counter Mode to be used.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Counter Mode to be used This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_CounterMode_Up: TIM Up Counting Mode
TIM_CounterMode_Down: TIM Down Counting Mode
TIM_CounterMode_CenterAligned1: TIM Center Aligned Mode1
TIM_CounterMode_CenterAligned2: TIM Center Aligned Mode2
TIM_CounterMode_CenterAligned3: TIM Center Aligned Mode3

section.title: void TIM_SetCounter (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Counter)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Counter Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Counter register new value.

section.title: void TIM_SetAutoreload (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Autoreload)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Autoreload Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Autoreload register new value.

section.title: uint32_t TIM_GetCounter (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Gets the TIMx Counter value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
Register value

section.title: uint16_t TIM_GetPrescaler (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Gets the TIMx Prescaler value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
Register value.

section.title: void TIM_UpdateDisableConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or Disables the TIMx Update event.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
new state of the TIMx UDIS bit This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_UpdateRequestConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_UpdateSource)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Update Request Interrupt source.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Update source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_UpdateSource_Global: Source of update is the counter overflow/underflow or the setting of UG bit, or an update generation through the slave mode controller.
TIM_UpdateSource_Regular: Source of update is counter overflow/underflow.

section.title: void TIM_ARRPreloadConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables TIMx peripheral Preload register on ARR.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.
new state of the TIMx peripheral Preload register This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_SelectOnePulseMode (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OPMode)
section.emphasis: Selects the TIMx's One Pulse Mode.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the OPM Mode to be used. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OPMode_Single
TIM_OPMode_Repetitive

section.title: void TIM_SetClockDivision (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_CKD)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Clock Division value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the clock division value. This parameter can be one of the following value:
TIM_CKD_DIV1: TDTS = Tck_tim
TIM_CKD_DIV2: TDTS = 2*Tck_tim
TIM_CKD_DIV4: TDTS = 4*Tck_tim

section.title: void TIM_Cmd (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the specified TIM peripheral.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIMx peripheral.
new state of the TIMx peripheral. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_OC1Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel1 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OC2Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel2 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OC3Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel3 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OC4Init (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIMx Channel4 according to the specified parameters in the TIM_OCInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_OCStructInit (TIM_OCInitTypeDef *TIM_OCInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each TIM_OCInitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: pointer to a TIM_OCInitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void TIM_SelectOCxM (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_Channel, uint16_t TIM_OCMode)
section.emphasis: Selects the TIM Output Compare Mode.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function disables the selected channel before changing the Output Compare Mode. If needed, user has to enable this channel using TIM_CCxCmd() and TIM_CCxNCmd() functions.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM Channel This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_Channel_1: TIM Channel 1
TIM_Channel_2: TIM Channel 2
TIM_Channel_3: TIM Channel 3
TIM_Channel_4: TIM Channel 4

specifies the TIM Output Compare Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCMode_Timing
TIM_OCMode_Active
TIM_OCMode_Toggle
TIM_OCMode_PWM1
TIM_OCMode_PWM2
TIM_ForcedAction_Active
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare1 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare1)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare1 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare1 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare2 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare2)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare2 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare2 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare3 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare3)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare3 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare3 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_SetCompare4 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint32_t Compare4)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Capture Compare4 Register value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
specifies the Capture Compare4 register new value.

section.title: void TIM_ForcedOC1Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ForcedAction)
section.emphasis: Forces the TIMx output 1 waveform to active or inactive level.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the forced Action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ForcedAction_Active: Force active level on OC1REF
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive: Force inactive level on OC1REF.

section.title: void TIM_ForcedOC2Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ForcedAction)
section.emphasis: Forces the TIMx output 2 waveform to active or inactive level.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the forced Action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ForcedAction_Active: Force active level on OC2REF
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive: Force inactive level on OC2REF.

section.title: void TIM_ForcedOC3Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ForcedAction)
section.emphasis: Forces the TIMx output 3 waveform to active or inactive level.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the forced Action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ForcedAction_Active: Force active level on OC3REF
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive: Force inactive level on OC3REF.

section.title: void TIM_ForcedOC4Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ForcedAction)
section.emphasis: Forces the TIMx output 4 waveform to active or inactive level.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the forced Action to be set to the output waveform. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ForcedAction_Active: Force active level on OC4REF
TIM_ForcedAction_InActive: Force inactive level on OC4REF.

section.title: void TIM_OC1PreloadConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCPreload)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIMx peripheral Preload register on CCR1.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the TIMx peripheral Preload register This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCPreload_Enable
TIM_OCPreload_Disable

new state of the TIMx peripheral Preload register This parameter can be one of the following values:

section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIMx peripheral Preload register on CCR4.

section.title: void TIM_OC1FastConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCFast)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Output Compare 1 Fast feature.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the Output Compare Fast Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCFast_Enable: TIM output compare fast enable
TIM_OCFast_Disable: TIM output compare fast disable

new state of the Output Compare Fast Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:

new state of the Output Compare Fast Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:

section.title: void TIM_ClearOC1Ref (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCClear)
section.emphasis: Clears or safeguards the OCREF1 signal on an external event.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

new state of the Output Compare Clear Enable Bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCClear_Enable: TIM Output clear enable
TIM_OCClear_Disable: TIM Output clear disable

section.title: void TIM_OC1PolarityConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_OCPolarity)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx channel 1 polarity.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the OC1 Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_OCPolarity_High: Output Compare active high
TIM_OCPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

TIM_OCNPolarity_Low: Output Compare active low

section.title: void TIM_CCxCmd (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_Channel, uint16_t TIM_CCx)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIM Capture Compare Channel x.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM Channel This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_Channel_1: TIM Channel 1
TIM_Channel_2: TIM Channel 2
TIM_Channel_3: TIM Channel 3
TIM_Channel_4: TIM Channel 4
specifies the TIM Channel CCxE bit new state. This parameter can be: TIM_CCx_Enable or TIM_CCx_Disable.

section.title: void TIM_CCxNCmd (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_Channel, uint16_t TIM_CCxN)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIM Capture Compare Channel xN.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM Channel This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_Channel_1: TIM Channel 1
TIM_Channel_2: TIM Channel 2
TIM_Channel_3: TIM Channel 3
specifies the TIM Channel CCxNE bit new state. This parameter can be: TIM_CCxN_Enable or TIM_CCxN_Disable.

section.title: void TIM_ICInit (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_ICInitTypeDef *TIM_ICInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the TIM peripheral according to the specified parameters in the TIM_ICInitStruct.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_ICInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_ICStructInit (TIM_ICInitTypeDef *TIM_ICInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each TIM_ICInitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: pointer to a TIM_ICInitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void TIM_PWMIConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_ICInitTypeDef *TIM_ICInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIM peripheral according to the specified parameters in the TIM_ICInitStruct to measure an external PWM signal.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5,8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.
pointer to a TIM_ICInitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the specified TIM peripheral.

section.title: uint32_t TIM_GetCapture1 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Gets the TIMx Input Capture 1 value.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.
Compare 1 Register value.

section.title: uint32_t TIM_GetCapture2 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Gets the TIMx Input Capture 2 value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.
Compare 2 Register value.

section.title: uint32_t TIM_GetCapture3 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Gets the TIMx Input Capture 3 value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
Compare 3 Register value.

section.title: uint32_t TIM_GetCapture4 (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Gets the TIMx Input Capture 4 value.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
Compare 4 Register value.

section.title: void TIM_SetIC1Prescaler (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ICPSC)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Input Capture 1 prescaler.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 except 6 and 7, to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Input Capture1 prescaler new value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ICPSC_DIV1: no prescaler
TIM_ICPSC_DIV2: capture is done once every 2 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV4: capture is done once every 4 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV8: capture is done once every 8 events

section.title: void TIM_SetIC2Prescaler (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ICPSC)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Input Capture 2 prescaler.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Input Capture2 prescaler new value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ICPSC_DIV1: no prescaler
TIM_ICPSC_DIV2: capture is done once every 2 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV4: capture is done once every 4 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV8: capture is done once every 8 events

section.title: void TIM_SetIC3Prescaler (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ICPSC)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Input Capture 3 prescaler.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Input Capture3 prescaler new value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ICPSC_DIV1: no prescaler
TIM_ICPSC_DIV2: capture is done once every 2 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV4: capture is done once every 4 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV8: capture is done once every 8 events

section.title: void TIM_SetIC4Prescaler (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ICPSC)
section.emphasis: Sets the TIMx Input Capture 4 prescaler.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Input Capture4 prescaler new value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ICPSC_DIV1: no prescaler
TIM_ICPSC_DIV2: capture is done once every 2 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV4: capture is done once every 4 events
TIM_ICPSC_DIV8: capture is done once every 8 events

section.title: void TIM_BDTRConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, TIM_BDTRInitTypeDef *TIM_BDTRInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Configures the Break feature, dead time, Lock level, OSSI/OSSR State and the AOE(automatic output enable).

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIM
pointer to a TIM_BDTRInitTypeDef structure that contains the BDTR Register configuration information for the TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_BDTRStructInit (TIM_BDTRInitTypeDef *TIM_BDTRInitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each TIM_BDTRInitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: pointer to a TIM_BDTRInitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void TIM_CtrlPWMOutputs (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIM peripheral Main Outputs.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIMx peripheral.
new state of the TIM peripheral Main Outputs. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_SelectCOM (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Selects the TIM peripheral Commutation event.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIMx peripheral
new state of the Commutation event. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_CCPreloadControl (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Sets or Resets the TIM peripheral Capture Compare Preload Control bit.

entry.para: where x can be 1 or 8 to select the TIMx peripheral
new state of the Capture Compare Preload Control bit This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_ITConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_IT, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the specified TIM interrupts.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIMx peripheral.

specifies the TIM interrupts sources to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
TIM_IT_Update: TIM update Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC1: TIM Capture Compare 1 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC2: TIM Capture Compare 2 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC3: TIM Capture Compare 3 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC4: TIM Capture Compare 4 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_COM: TIM Commutation Interrupt source
TIM_IT_Trigger: TIM Trigger Interrupt source
TIM_IT_Break: TIM Break Interrupt source

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: For TIM6 and TIM7 only the parameter TIM_IT_Update can be used
For TIM9 and TIM12 only one of the following parameters can be used: TIM_IT_Update, TIM_IT_CC1, TIM_IT_CC2 or TIM_IT_Trigger.
For TIM10, TIM11, TIM13 and TIM14 only one of the following parameters can be used: TIM_IT_Update or TIM_IT_CC1
TIM_IT_COM and TIM_IT_Break can be used only with TIM1 and TIM8

entry.para: new state of the TIM interrupts. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_GenerateEvent (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_EventSource)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx event to be generate by software.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the event source. This parameter can be one or more of the following values:
TIM_EventSource_Update: Timer update Event source
TIM_EventSource_CC1: Timer Capture Compare 1 Event source
TIM_EventSource_CC2: Timer Capture Compare 2 Event source
TIM_EventSource_CC3: Timer Capture Compare 3 Event source
TIM_EventSource_CC4: Timer Capture Compare 4 Event source
TIM_EventSource_COM: Timer COM event source
TIM_EventSource_Trigger: Timer Trigger Event source
TIM_EventSource_Break: Timer Break event source

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: TIM6 and TIM7 can only generate an update event.
TIM_EventSource_COM and TIM_EventSource_Break are used only with TIM1 and TIM8.

section.title: FlagStatus TIM_GetFlagStatus (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified TIM flag is set or not.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the flag to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_FLAG_Update: TIM update Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC1: TIM Capture Compare 1 Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC2: TIM Capture Compare 2 Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC3: TIM Capture Compare 3 Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC4: TIM Capture Compare 4 Flag
TIM_FLAG_COM: TIM Commutation Flag
TIM_FLAG_Trigger: TIM Trigger Flag
TIM_FLAG_Break: TIM Break Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC1OF: TIM Capture Compare 1 over capture Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC2OF: TIM Capture Compare 2 over capture Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC3OF: TIM Capture Compare 3 over capture Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC4OF: TIM Capture Compare 4 over capture Flag

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: TIM6 and TIM7 can have only one update flag.
TIM_FLAG_COM and TIM_FLAG_Break are used only with TIM1 and TIM8.

entry.para: new state of TIM_FLAG (SET or RESET).

section.title: void TIM_ClearFlag (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Clears the TIMx's pending flags.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the flag bit to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
TIM_FLAG_Update: TIM update Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC1: TIM Capture Compare 1 Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC2: TIM Capture Compare 2 Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC3: TIM Capture Compare 3 Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC4: TIM Capture Compare 4 Flag
TIM_FLAG_COM: TIM Commutation Flag
TIM_FLAG_Trigger: TIM Trigger Flag
TIM_FLAG_Break: TIM Break Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC1OF: TIM Capture Compare 1 over capture Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC2OF: TIM Capture Compare 2 over capture Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC3OF: TIM Capture Compare 3 over capture Flag
TIM_FLAG_CC4OF: TIM Capture Compare 4 over capture Flag

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: TIM6 and TIM7 can have only one update flag.
TIM_FLAG_COM and TIM_FLAG_Break are used only with TIM1 and TIM8.

section.title: ITStatus TIM_GetITStatus (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_IT)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the TIM interrupt has occurred or not.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM interrupt source to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_IT_Update: TIM update Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC1: TIM Capture Compare 1 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC2: TIM Capture Compare 2 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC3: TIM Capture Compare 3 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC4: TIM Capture Compare 4 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_COM: TIM Commutation Interrupt source
TIM_IT_Trigger: TIM Trigger Interrupt source
TIM_IT_Break: TIM Break Interrupt source

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: TIM6 and TIM7 can generate only an update interrupt.
TIM_IT_COM and TIM_IT_Break are used only with TIM1 and TIM8.

entry.para: new state of the TIM_IT(SET or RESET).

section.title: void TIM_ClearITPendingBit (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_IT)
section.emphasis: Clears the TIMx's interrupt pending bits.

entry.para: where x can be 1 to 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the pending bit to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
TIM_IT_Update: TIM1 update Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC1: TIM Capture Compare 1 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC2: TIM Capture Compare 2 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC3: TIM Capture Compare 3 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_CC4: TIM Capture Compare 4 Interrupt source
TIM_IT_COM: TIM Commutation Interrupt source
TIM_IT_Trigger: TIM Trigger Interrupt source
TIM_IT_Break: TIM Break Interrupt source

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: TIM6 and TIM7 can generate only an update interrupt.
TIM_IT_COM and TIM_IT_Break are used only with TIM1 and TIM8.

section.title: void TIM_DMAConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_DMABase, uint16_t TIM_DMABurstLength)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx's DMA interface.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

DMA Base address. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_DMABase_CR1
TIM_DMABase_CR2
TIM_DMABase_SMCR
TIM_DMABase_DIER
TIM1_DMABase_SR
TIM_DMABase_EGR
TIM_DMABase_CCMR1
TIM_DMABase_CCMR2
TIM_DMABase_CCER
TIM_DMABase_CNT
TIM_DMABase_PSC
TIM_DMABase_ARR
TIM_DMABase_RCR
TIM_DMABase_CCR1
TIM_DMABase_CCR2
TIM_DMABase_CCR3
TIM_DMABase_CCR4
TIM_DMABase_BDTR
TIM_DMABase_DCR
DMA Burst length. This parameter can be one value between: TIM_DMABurstLength_1Transfer and TIM_DMABurstLength_18Transfers.

section.title: void TIM_DMACmd (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_DMASource, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIMx's DMA Requests.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the DMA Request sources. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
TIM_DMA_Update: TIM update Interrupt source
TIM_DMA_CC1: TIM Capture Compare 1 DMA source
TIM_DMA_CC2: TIM Capture Compare 2 DMA source
TIM_DMA_CC3: TIM Capture Compare 3 DMA source
TIM_DMA_CC4: TIM Capture Compare 4 DMA source
TIM_DMA_COM: TIM Commutation DMA source
TIM_DMA_Trigger: TIM Trigger DMA source
new state of the DMA Request sources. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_SelectCCDMA (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Selects the TIMx peripheral Capture Compare DMA source.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.
new state of the Capture Compare DMA source This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_InternalClockConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx internal Clock.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

section.title: void TIM_ITRxExternalClockConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_InputTriggerSource)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Internal Trigger as External Clock.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

Trigger source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_TS_ITR0: Internal Trigger 0
TIM_TS_ITR1: Internal Trigger 1
TIM_TS_ITR2: Internal Trigger 2
TIM_TS_ITR3: Internal Trigger 3

section.title: void TIM_TIxExternalClockConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_TIxExternalCLKSource, uint16_t TIM_ICPolarity, uint16_t ICFilter)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Trigger as External Clock.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13 or 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

Trigger source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_TIxExternalCLK1Source_TI1ED: TI1 Edge Detector
TIM_TIxExternalCLK1Source_TI1: Filtered Timer Input 1
TIM_TIxExternalCLK1Source_TI2: Filtered Timer Input 2

specifies the TIx Polarity. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ICPolarity_Rising
TIM_ICPolarity_Falling
specifies the filter value. This parameter must be a value between 0x0 and 0xF.

section.title: void TIM_ETRClockMode1Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ExtTRGPrescaler, uint16_t TIM_ExtTRGPolarity, uint16_t ExtTRGFilter)
section.emphasis: Configures the External clock Mode1.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

The external Trigger Prescaler. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_OFF: ETRP Prescaler OFF.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV2: ETRP frequency divided by 2.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV4: ETRP frequency divided by 4.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV8: ETRP frequency divided by 8.

The external Trigger Polarity. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ExtTRGPolarity_Inverted: active low or falling edge active.
TIM_ExtTRGPolarity_NonInverted: active high or rising edge active.
External Trigger Filter. This parameter must be a value between 0x00 and 0x0F

section.title: void TIM_ETRClockMode2Config (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ExtTRGPrescaler, uint16_t TIM_ExtTRGPolarity, uint16_t ExtTRGFilter)
section.emphasis: Configures the External clock Mode2.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

The external Trigger Prescaler. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_OFF: ETRP Prescaler OFF.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV2: ETRP frequency divided by 2.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV4: ETRP frequency divided by 4.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV8: ETRP frequency divided by 8.

The external Trigger Polarity. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ExtTRGPolarity_Inverted: active low or falling edge active.
TIM_ExtTRGPolarity_NonInverted: active high or rising edge active.
External Trigger Filter. This parameter must be a value between 0x00 and 0x0F

section.title: void TIM_SelectInputTrigger (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_InputTriggerSource)
section.emphasis: Selects the Input Trigger source.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13 or 14 to select the TIM peripheral.

The Input Trigger source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_TS_ITR0: Internal Trigger 0
TIM_TS_ITR1: Internal Trigger 1
TIM_TS_ITR2: Internal Trigger 2
TIM_TS_ITR3: Internal Trigger 3
TIM_TS_TI1F_ED: TI1 Edge Detector
TIM_TS_TI1FP1: Filtered Timer Input 1
TIM_TS_TI2FP2: Filtered Timer Input 2
TIM_TS_ETRF: External Trigger input

section.title: void TIM_SelectOutputTrigger (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_TRGOSource)
section.emphasis: Selects the TIMx Trigger Output Mode.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Trigger Output source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
For all TIMx
TIM_TRGOSource_Reset: The UG bit in the TIM_EGR register is used as the trigger output(TRGO)
TIM_TRGOSource_Enable: The Counter Enable CEN is used as the trigger output(TRGO)
TIM_TRGOSource_Update: The update event is selected as the trigger output(TRGO)
For all TIMx except TIM6 and TIM7
TIM_TRGOSource_OC1: The trigger output sends a positive pulse when the CC1IF flag is to be set, as soon as a capture or compare match occurs(TRGO)
TIM_TRGOSource_OC1Ref: OC1REF signal is used as the trigger output(TRGO)
TIM_TRGOSource_OC2Ref: OC2REF signal is used as the trigger output(TRGO)
TIM_TRGOSource_OC3Ref: OC3REF signal is used as the trigger output(TRGO)
TIM_TRGOSource_OC4Ref: OC4REF signal is used as the trigger output(TRGO)

section.title: void TIM_SelectSlaveMode (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_SlaveMode)
section.emphasis: Selects the TIMx Slave Mode.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Timer Slave Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_SlaveMode_Reset: Rising edge of the selected trigger signal(TRGI) reinitialize the counter and triggers an update of the registers
TIM_SlaveMode_Gated: The counter clock is enabled when the trigger signal (TRGI) is high
TIM_SlaveMode_Trigger: The counter starts at a rising edge of the trigger TRGI
TIM_SlaveMode_External1: Rising edges of the selected trigger (TRGI) clock the counter

section.title: void TIM_SelectMasterSlaveMode (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_MasterSlaveMode)
section.emphasis: Sets or Resets the TIMx Master/Slave Mode.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the Timer Master Slave Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_MasterSlaveMode_Enable: synchronization between the current timer and its slaves (through TRGO)
TIM_MasterSlaveMode_Disable: No action

section.title: void TIM_ETRConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_ExtTRGPrescaler, uint16_t TIM_ExtTRGPolarity, uint16_t ExtTRGFilter)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx External Trigger (ETR).

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 or 8 to select the TIM peripheral.

The external Trigger Prescaler. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_OFF: ETRP Prescaler OFF.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV2: ETRP frequency divided by 2.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV4: ETRP frequency divided by 4.
TIM_ExtTRGPSC_DIV8: ETRP frequency divided by 8.

The external Trigger Polarity. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ExtTRGPolarity_Inverted: active low or falling edge active.
TIM_ExtTRGPolarity_NonInverted: active high or rising edge active.
External Trigger Filter. This parameter must be a value between 0x00 and 0x0F

section.title: void TIM_EncoderInterfaceConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_EncoderMode, uint16_t TIM_IC1Polarity, uint16_t TIM_IC2Polarity)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIMx Encoder Interface.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIMx Encoder Mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_EncoderMode_TI1: Counter counts on TI1FP1 edge depending on TI2FP2 level.
TIM_EncoderMode_TI2: Counter counts on TI2FP2 edge depending on TI1FP1 level.
TIM_EncoderMode_TI12: Counter counts on both TI1FP1 and TI2FP2 edges depending on the level of the other input.

specifies the IC1 Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ICPolarity_Falling: IC Falling edge.
TIM_ICPolarity_Rising: IC Rising edge.

specifies the IC2 Polarity This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM_ICPolarity_Falling: IC Falling edge.
TIM_ICPolarity_Rising: IC Rising edge.

section.title: void TIM_SelectHallSensor (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the TIMx's Hall sensor interface.

entry.para: where x can be 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 or 12 to select the TIM peripheral.
new state of the TIMx Hall sensor interface. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void TIM_RemapConfig (TIM_TypeDef *TIMx, uint16_t TIM_Remap)
section.emphasis: Configures the TIM2, TIM5 and TIM11 Remapping input capabilities.

entry.para: where x can be 2, 5 or 11 to select the TIM peripheral.

specifies the TIM input remapping source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
TIM2_TIM8_TRGO: TIM2 ITR1 input is connected to TIM8 Trigger output(default)
TIM2_ETH_PTP: TIM2 ITR1 input is connected to ETH PTP trogger output.
TIM2_USBFS_SOF: TIM2 ITR1 input is connected to USB FS SOF.
TIM2_USBHS_SOF: TIM2 ITR1 input is connected to USB HS SOF.
TIM5_GPIO: TIM5 CH4 input is connected to dedicated Timer pin(default)
TIM5_LSI: TIM5 CH4 input is connected to LSI clock.
TIM5_LSE: TIM5 CH4 input is connected to LSE clock.
TIM5_RTC: TIM5 CH4 input is connected to RTC Output event.
TIM11_GPIO: TIM11 CH4 input is connected to dedicated Timer pin(default)
TIM11_HSE: TIM11 CH4 input is connected to HSE_RTC clock (HSE divided by a programmable prescaler)
